revised_title: Observations on Swarms of Insects Infesting Ireland
tldr: Dr. Thomas Molyneux, a fellow of the Royal Society, documented the infestation of swarms of insects in Ireland, causing significant damage to trees, crops, and homes. The insects were particularly problematic due to their large numbers, aggressive behavior, and ability to reproduce rapidly. Molyneux also observed that certain environmental factors, such as weather conditions and smoke, could help control the insect populations.
